717364f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 27th Street
717364f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, from 29th to 27th Streets. In the
immediate foreground is the Hotel Breslin. The large white
building, in the extreme right background is the Victoria
Biuilding, on the site of the Hotel Victoria, which was made
famous by the patronage of President Grover Cleveland.
P. L. Sperr  July 3, 1928
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
Broadway, east side, from 29th to 31st Streets. In the
foreground is the old Gilsey House, built in the early 1870s,
converted into an office building between 1910 and 1916, and
still standing in 1936.
P. L. Sperr  June 2, 1928
NO RERRODUCTIONS
(3)
Broadway, east side, north from and including 28th Street.
In the centre of the picture is the Hotel Breslin, and above
it is the famous Gilsey House, now remodeled into an office
buildins.
P. L. Sperr  June 2, 1928
NO REPRODUCCTIONS

717367f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 27th Street
717367f.text:
John L. Sullivan's saloon, 1177 Broadway, west side, between
27th and 28th Streets. Sullivan opened the saloon after losing
his title to James J. Corbett and his precedent has been followed
by Corbett and Jack Dempsey, to mention only two names. On the
first floor fire escape is a life-size aillboard of Colonel
.:illiam F. Cody,(Buffalo Bill).
about 1893.
International News.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717362f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 27th Street
717362f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north from, but not inoluding, 27th Street.
July 13, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717365f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 27th Street
717365f.text:
Broadway, north from 27th Street. The buildings in the left
foreground were once the Coleman House, but have now, through re-
modelling, lost all resemblance to their former state. The building
on the S.W. corner of 28th Street was once a five-story building,
as is clearly shown by the contrast of the older with the newer
part of the building. Proctor's Fifth Avenue Theatre is housed in
old buildings which date back at least to the eighties.
1926.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
